Flu.summary: Influenza is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
Flu.prognosis: Most people recover within a week. Rest, hydration, and antiviral medications can help.

medical_parameters.name: temperature
medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

medical_parameters.name: blood_pressure
medical_parameters.question: What is your blood pressure? (e.g., 120/80 mmHg)

Common Cold.summary: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, typically mild and self-limiting.
Common Cold.prognosis: Usually resolves within 7-10 days. Rest and symptomatic treatment recommended.

medical_parameters.name: temperature
medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

Pneumonia.summary: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid.
Pneumonia.prognosis: Can be serious. Requires medical intervention, antibiotics, and possible hospitalization.

medical_parameters.name: temperature
medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

medical_parameters.name: oxygen_saturation
medical_parameters.question: What is your oxygen saturation level? (e.g., 98%)

medical_parameters.name: respiratory_rate
medical_parameters.question: What is your respiratory rate? (breaths per minute)

Dengue.summary: A mosquito-borne viral infection prevalent in tropical and subtropical regions.
Dengue.prognosis: Most cases resolve in 1-2 weeks. Severe cases can be life-threatening and require immediate medical attention.

medical_parameters.name: temperature
medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

medical_parameters.name: platelet_count
medical_parameters.question: What is your platelet count? (e.g., 150,000/µL)

COVID-19.summary: A highly infectious respiratory disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus.
COVID-19.prognosis: Varies widely. Most recover, but some develop severe complications. Vaccination and medical support crucial.
COVID-19.specialists: General Practitioner, Pulmonologist, Infectious Disease Specialist

medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

medical_parameters.name: oxygen_saturation
medical_parameters.question: What is your oxygen saturation level? (e.g., 98%)

medical_parameters.name: respiratory_rate
medical_parameters.question: What is your respiratory rate? (breaths per minute)

Heart Disease.summary: A range of conditions affecting the heart's structure and function.
Heart Disease.prognosis: Chronic condition requiring lifestyle changes, medication, and potential surgical interventions.

medical_parameters.name: blood_pressure
medical_parameters.question: What is your blood pressure? (e.g., 120/80 mmHg)

medical_parameters.name: cholesterol_level
medical_parameters.question: What is your total cholesterol level? (e.g., 200 mg/dL)

medical_parameters.name: ECG
medical_parameters.question: Have you had an ECG? Describe any abnormalities.

medical_parameters.name: troponin_level
medical_parameters.question: What is your troponin level? (ng/L)

medical_parameters.name: echocardiogram
medical_parameters.question: Have you had an echocardiogram? Describe any abnormalities.

Diabetes.summary: A metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels.
Diabetes.prognosis: Manageable with medication, diet, exercise, and regular monitoring.

medical_parameters.name: blood_glucose
medical_parameters.question: What is your fasting blood glucose level? (e.g., 100 mg/dL)

medical_parameters.name: HbA1c
medical_parameters.question: What is your HbA1c level? (e.g., 6.0%)

Migraine.summary: A neurological condition causing intense, debilitating headaches.
Migraine.prognosis: Chronic but manageable with medication, lifestyle changes, and trigger avoidance.

Asthma.summary: A chronic respiratory condition causing inflammation and narrowing of airways.
Asthma.prognosis: Controllable with medications, inhalers, and avoiding triggers.

medical_parameters.name: peak_flow
medical_parameters.question: What is your peak expiratory flow rate? (PEFR)
medical_parameters.normal_range: Varies by age, sex, and height

medical_parameters.name: oxygen_saturation
medical_parameters.question: What is your oxygen saturation level? (e.g., 98%)

Gastroenteritis.summary: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, often caused by viral infections.
Gastroenteritis.prognosis: Usually resolves within a few days. Hydration and rest are key to recovery.

medical_parameters.name: temperature
medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

medical_parameters.name: dehydration_signs
medical_parameters.question: Are you experiencing signs of dehydration? (e.g., dry mouth, decreased urination)

Tuberculosis.summary: A bacterial infection that mainly affects the lungs but can spread to other organs.
Tuberculosis.prognosis: Requires long-term antibiotic treatment. Can be severe if untreated.

medical_parameters.name: temperature
medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

medical_parameters.name: sputum_test
medical_parameters.question: Have you had a sputum test? What were the results?

medical_parameters.name: chest_xray
medical_parameters.question: Have you had a chest X-ray? Describe any abnormalities.

Malaria.summary: A mosquito-borne parasitic infection common in tropical areas.
Malaria.prognosis: Can be fatal if untreated. Requires antimalarial drugs and supportive care.

medical_parameters.name: temperature
medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

medical_parameters.name: blood_smear
medical_parameters.question: Have you had a blood smear test? What were the results?

Typhoid.summary: A bacterial infection spread through contaminated food and water.
Typhoid.prognosis: Requires antibiotics. Recovery takes several weeks.

medical_parameters.name: temperature
medical_parameters.question: What is your body temperature? (e.g., 37°C or 98.6°F)

medical_parameters.name: blood_culture
medical_parameters.question: Have you had a blood culture test? What were the results?

Hypertension.summary: A condition characterized by persistently high blood pressure.
Hypertension.prognosis: Manageable with lifestyle changes and medication. Can lead to severe complications if untreated.

medical_parameters.name: blood_pressure
medical_parameters.question: What is your blood pressure? (e.g., 120/80 mmHg)

Anemia.summary: A condition where the blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells.
Anemia.prognosis: Manageable with dietary changes, supplements, and treatment of underlying causes.

medical_parameters.name: hemoglobin_level
medical_parameters.question: What is your hemoglobin level? (g/dL)

medical_parameters.name: iron_level
medical_parameters.question: What is your iron level? (µg/dL)

Arthritis.summary: Inflammation of the joints causing pain and stiffness.
Arthritis.prognosis: Chronic but manageable with medication, therapy, and lifestyle adjustments.

medical_parameters.name: ESR
medical_parameters.question: What is your Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)? (mm/hr)

medical_parameters.name: CRP
medical_parameters.question: What is your C-Reactive Protein (CRP) level? (mg/L)

Stroke.summary: A medical emergency caused by a blockage or rupture in brain blood vessels.
Stroke.prognosis: Requires immediate medical attention. Recovery depends on severity.

medical_parameters.name: blood_pressure
medical_parameters.question: What is your blood pressure? (e.g., 120/80 mmHg)

medical_parameters.name: CT_scan
medical_parameters.question: Have you had a brain CT scan? Describe any abnormalities.

Alzheimer's Disease.summary: A progressive brain disorder that affects memory and cognitive function.
Alzheimer's Disease.prognosis: No cure, but treatment can help manage symptoms and slow progression.

medical_parameters.name: MMSE
medical_parameters.question: What was your score on the Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE)?

Parkinson's Disease.summary: A neurological disorder that affects movement and coordination.
Parkinson's Disease.prognosis: Chronic and progressive. Medications and therapy can help manage symptoms.

medical_parameters.name: UPDRS
medical_parameters.question: What was your score on the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS)?

Hepatitis.summary: Inflammation of the liver caused by viruses, alcohol, or toxins.
Hepatitis.prognosis: Varies depending on type. Some forms are self-limiting, while others require long-term treatment.

medical_parameters.name: liver_enzymes
medical_parameters.question: What are your liver enzyme levels (AST, ALT)? (U/L)

medical_parameters.name: bilirubin_level
medical_parameters.question: What is your bilirubin level? (mg/dL)

Epilepsy.summary: A neurological disorder causing recurrent seizures.
Epilepsy.prognosis: Manageable with medication. Some cases may require surgery.

medical_parameters.name: EEG
medical_parameters.question: Have you had an electroencephalogram (EEG)? Describe any abnormalities.

Depression.summary: A mental health disorder affecting mood and daily life.
Depression.prognosis: Treatable with therapy, medication, and lifestyle changes.

medical_parameters.name: PHQ-9
medical_parameters.question: What was your score on the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)?

Schizophrenia.summary: A severe mental disorder affecting perception and cognition.
Schizophrenia.prognosis: Requires lifelong treatment with medication and therapy.

medical_parameters.name: PANSS
medical_parameters.question: What was your score on the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS)?
